workflow.title: How the WhatsApp-to-invoice loop runs
workflow.subtitle: Every stage mirrors the PlumbingAgent MVP flow with organiser sign-off.

steps.title: 1. Intake
steps.description: AI triages WhatsApp, labels urgency and drafts the organiser response.

steps.title: 2. Approve & send
steps.description: Organiser reviews, edits or approves. Customers only see human-checked replies.

steps.title: 3. Schedule & job card
steps.description: Approved slots update Schedule-X, create offline-ready job cards and notify crews.

steps.title: 4. Invoice & follow-up
steps.description: Voice notes become Moneybird invoices with Mollie links and GDPR-compliant dunning.

faq.title: Common questions
faq.subtitle: Answers for organisers, technicians and owners considering a WhatsApp-first workflow.

items.question: How much control do organisers keep?
items.answer: Every AI suggestion stays in draft until an organiser approves or edits it. You can take over any conversation instantly.

items.question: Can we keep our existing WhatsApp numbers?
items.answer: Yes. We provision a customer-facing number and a control-room number, then forward existing lines so customers experience a seamless switch.

items.question: Is everything GDPR compliant?
items.answer: PlumbingAgent runs on EU infrastructure, enforces retention policies and offers DSAR exports on demand.

items.question: Does it work offline for crews?
items.answer: Job cards sync offline-first so crews can capture photos, notes and signatures even in basement boiler rooms.

items.question: Which invoicing providers do you support?
items.answer: Moneybird is live today with e-Boekhouden and WeFact in pilot. Mollie iDEAL handles payments and dunning triggers.

finalCta.title: Ready to run your plumbing ops through WhatsApp?
